_meanings:
{@--3@} A numerical figure;
a number; the number {9}

{@--5@} An act of a drama,
for its nature &c, See <ls>S. D. 278.</ls>
{@--6@} A hook or curved instrument.

{@--7@} A species of dramatic 
composition, one of the ten varieties of
{#rUpaka#}, See <ls>S. D. 519.</ls>

{@--8@} An 
ornament ({#BUzA#}).

{@--9@} A sham fight,
military show ({#citrayudDa#}).

{@--10@} A
coefficient.
{@--11@} A place.

{@--12@} A sin,
misdeed.

{@--13@} A line, curved line; a
curve or bend generally, the bend in
the arm.
{@--14@} The body.

{@--15@} A 
mountain. [<ab>cf.</ab> <ab>L.</ab> {%uncus%}; <ab>Gr.</ab> {%ogkos%}].
water.
marking, branding &c.

the science
of numbers (arithmetical or 
algebraical).

{1} bearing or
having marks, such as those on the
body of a Vaiṣṇava.

{2} manner of
holding the person, figure.

{1} turning on the other
side.

<ab>N.</ab> of a Vrata;
title of a chapter in the {#BavizyottarapurARa#}.

{2} [ 
{#aMkena pAlayati pAl-i#}. {#tf#}. {#ta#}.] a nurse.

multiplication of numbers
or figures.

. forming the lap,
bending the thighs into a curve and
squatting down.

{2} branding with
a mark that resembles a headless
trunk ({#aSiraHpuruzAkAroMkaH#}).

{1} seated in the
lap or carried on the hip, as an 
infant.
{3} premature, early ripe, forced fruit.

(or {#AsyaM#}) that part of an act,
wherein the subject of all the acts
is intimated, is called {#aMkamuKa#}, which
suggests the {%germ%} as well as the
{%end%}, {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} in <ls>Māl. 1</ls> {#kAmaMdakI#} and  
{#avalokitA#} hint the parts to be played by
{#BUrivasu#} and others and give the 
arrangement of the plot in brief
({#yatra syAdaMka ekasminnaMkAnAM sUcanAKilA .#} 
{#tadaMkamuKamityAhurbIjArTaKyApakaM ca tat ..#}  
<ls>S. D. 312</ls>). The Daśarūpa defines it thus:
{#aMkAMtapAtrEraMkAsyaM CinnAMkasyArTasUcanAt .#} {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}
where a character at the end of
an act cuts short the story and 
introduces the beginning of another
act; as in the second of <ls>Mv.</ls>

a kind of tree
({#ciMcowa#}) ginger.

subtraction
of numbers.

the science of
numbers, arithmetic.
